chart_description: The CPU softirqs chart displays the rate of software interrupts handled by the CPU per second. These interrupts are generated by the Linux kernel to handle network, block I/O, timer, scheduler, RCU, tasklet, and other events.

dimension_descriptions.BLOCK: The rate of block device software interrupt requests.
dimension_descriptions.NET_RX: The rate of software interrupt requests generated by incoming network packets.
dimension_descriptions.NET_TX: The rate of software interrupt requests generated by outgoing network packets.
dimension_descriptions.RCU: The rate of RCU (Read-Copy-Update) software interrupt requests, which are used for read-side critical sections in the Linux kernel.
dimension_descriptions.SCHED: The rate of scheduler software interrupt requests, which can be triggered by process events like context switches.
dimension_descriptions.TASKLET: The rate of tasklet software interrupt requests, which are used for deferrable function execution in the Linux kernel.
dimension_descriptions.TIMER: The rate of timer software interrupt requests, which are generated by kernel timers.
